thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Hedge Fund Lansdowne Feels the Fee Squeeze

author: Laurence Fletcher
title: Hedge Fund Lansdowne Feels the Fee Squeeze
text:
Asset managers continue to rethink their charges in the face of tepid performance and a proliferation of low-cost managers as passive investing increasingly becomes investors’ default.
One of the latest adjustments comes from Lansdowne Partners, one of the world’s largest hedge funds. The firm has cut the annual management fee on its flagship Developed Markets fund by 0.5% for clients who have been invested for more than 10 years, said two people familiar with the matter.
